JobFullDesc: About Us:At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, by combining our vast resources and investments we are able to dedicate ourselves to solving mission-level vs. product-level customer challenges – together we can anticipate more, move faster and make a bigger impact on the big picture. Whole Life Engineering (WLE) is responsible for ensuring our products are Safe, Reliable, and Maintainable and delivered on time.  WLE consists of multiple disciplines that support engineering, our program offices and our customers.  Our WLE disciplines participate in the total life cycle of our products from conception to deactivation.  Our focus area is product support, including the following disciplines:  Reliability System Safety and Supportability.Job Summary:The Mission Support & Sustainment (MS&S) Department seeks an experienced Logistician & Technical Writer based out of Tucson, AZ.   As a Logistician & Technical Writer, you'll be involved in the development and update of technical manuals and Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs), as well as the development of processes, procedures, techniques, training devices, and equipment used to train civilian and military personnel to operate and support the product.   You will also be responsible executing and leading tasks in the areas of Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), Sustainment Analysis, and Sustainment Planning, as well as identification and elevation of technical and schedule risks.  In addition, you will be performing logistics support and engineering analysis to develop provisioning data (such as readiness-based spares models) in a medium as required by the customer.   Responsibilities to Anticipate: Provide general engineering support for In-Service Support (ISS) activitiesDevelop engineering white papers and presentations to help inform customers and influence support decisionsPerform supportability analyses and provide recommendations for long term product support, including but not limited to spares recommendations, maintenance procedure updates, and parts and materials substitutions as neededEnsure the technical integrity, suitable quality, and adherence to standards of the ISS products produced for Logistics, Provisioning, Field Support, Intermediate Level Maintenance, and Depot Level Maintenance through engagement in peer reviews, program reviews, design reviews, failure review boards, investigation teams, and working groupsAssist with ISS influence on product design and productionDefine and promote technical strategies for long-term product sustainmentAct as a liaison with all engineering disciplines, such as Systems, Electrical, Mechanical, Test, Materials and Processes, and Structural design functionsRepresent ISS in the support of failure investigations, failure trend analysis, Failure Reporting, Analysis and Corrective Action System (FRACAS) participation, flight test planning/preparation, test failure analysis and recommended repair actionsInform and collaborate with the ISS Leadership Team to ensure technical success while balancing goals, approaches, and risks Domestic & International travel may be required (approximately 10% domestic and 5% international) Qualifications You Must Have:Education:  Bachelor's degree OR 8+ years of relevant professional experience may be considered in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.  (Two years of related work experience can substitute for one year of college education) Employment Experience:2+ years of logistics, engineering, technical writing or technical training experienceRelated experience in logistics, sustainment, support plans, system fielding, proposals, integration, or life cycle managementThe ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance. US citizenship is required as only US citizens are eligible for a security clearance. Qualifications We Value: System thinkingStrong interpersonal and communication skills to work with team membersWriting technical documentsAn understanding of the use of the Technical Data Package (drawings, parts lists, interface control documents, and electrical schematics)Familiarity with factory operations, procedures and depot flow activitiesExperience working with US Navy programsStrong analytical and problem solving skillsBroad knowledge of Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) processes, including sustainment and supportability principles and concepts  What We Offer: Whether you are just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits on offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.  Additional Details: This job is posted internally as: Senior Analyst, Engineering Services
